GradeMention.description:
ICD-O Oncology Grade (Tumor cell differentiation grade).

Grade reflects how closely the tumor cells resemble normal tissue:
  1 = Well differentiated
  2 = Moderately differentiated
  3 = Poorly differentiated
  4 = Undifferentiated / Anaplastic
  9 = Grade cannot be assessed

has_mention.description: Whether there is any mention of this variable in the text.
has_mention.title: Has Mention

spans.description: The text spans where this variable is mentioned.
spans.title: Spans

display.description: Human-readable ICD-O description of the tumor grade.
display.title: Display

GradeMention.title: GradeMention

MorphologyMention.description:
ICD-O Oncology Morphology (Histology + Behavior).

Morphology represents the microscopic tumor cell type (e.g., adenocarcinoma,
squamous cell carcinoma, lymphoma) combined with the behavior code.

has_mention.description: Whether there is any mention of this variable in the text.
has_mention.title: Has Mention

spans.description: The text spans where this variable is mentioned.
spans.title: Spans

code.description: ICD-O morphology code (M-####/x). Example: 8140/3 = Adenocarcinoma, NOS (malignant).
code.title: Code

MorphologyMention.title: MorphologyMention

enum: Medication ordered/administered during an inpatient/acute care setting
Medication ordered/administered during an outpatient setting
Medication ordered/consumed by the patient in their home (including long term care, nursing homes, etc)
RxCategory.title: RxCategory

enum: Checkpoint inhibitors, especially PD-1, PDL-1, CTLA-4
Cytokine therapy, especially IL-2 and interferon alpha
Other drug indicated for treatment of cancer(s)
RxClassCancer.title: RxClassCancer

RxRoute.description:
Route of Administration can "help" (but not deterministic) for drug metadata, examples
* Injection --> antibody for induction/rescue therapy
* Topical --> skin lesions
* Inhalation --> Steroid
https://build.fhir.org/valueset-route-codes.html
RxRoute.title: RxRoute

RxStatus.description:
Medication Status (including Intent because chart review is NOT always identical to Med Request)
https://build.fhir.org/valueset-medicationrequest-status.html
https://build.fhir.org/valueset-medicationrequest-intent.html
enum: Medication order is active (currently prescribed and intended for ongoing use).
Medication is planned/ordered/prescribed but therapy has not yet started.
Medication course is finished (all doses given or intended duration completed).
Medication was stopped or permanently discontinued before completion.
Medication order was canceled/withdrawn before any doses were administered.
Medication is temporarily paused (on-hold, suspended, or interrupted).
RxStatus.title: RxStatus

SurgeryMention.description:
Structured representation of a surgical procedure performed for a cancer
(e.g., low-grade glioma). Includes surgical type, approach, and extent of
resection when identifiable from the clinical note.

has_mention.description: Whether there is any mention of this variable in the text.

spans.title: Spans

surgical_type.description: High-level categorization of the surgery (biopsy, resection, ablation, etc.)

approach.description: Technical approach used during the surgery (open, awake, stereotactic, laser).

anatomical_site.description: Anatomical site of surgery (e.g., 'left frontal lobe', 'right temporal lobe').
anatomical_site.title: Anatomical Site

complications.description: Intraoperative or postoperative complications if mentioned.
complications.title: Complications

represents the primary tumor or a metastatic tumor.
